content.text: Get Lifemap ready for Vision Pro
Have notes in video call view, so agenda is right there
the edu tech company and the
InStrand should take the contract but frame it as a partnership with us, with Ryan being the product manager on this project.
Think about the long term vision we're going for e.g. Deep Tech Enterprise Consulting
Remove Plan, Grow and Consulting offerings, roll the consulting offerings into build. Reduce maintain to $500/month, also offer removed plans on the side under the table.
For the cursor, have a glowing ball, the user can select their outine colour but not the colour

for rewinding to a previous state in the case that the document gets into a bad/corrupt/invalid state

something from way down the list - hold controlscroll

Design how to create and switch between node types
Needs to detect and reflect the node present

Fix the flow menu of Maths nodes
No behaviour on how to select a maths, comment and other blocks such that the user can copy and paste, and change lenses
Should probably think of a kind of modal navigation. E.g. If you click inside a node, you can edit it. If you press escape, then you go up one level and then select the container that holds the node.
Portals, maths and other nodes when created, capture the content around them, when they should only capture content that's in the regex match
Some nodes don't include the matched regex content when creating a new node, even when using wrappingInputRule
Certain regexes don't match inside a group but do match outside of it, like the code block (```), to dos ([ ])

Compromise - instead of saving in NodeViewContent, just use an attribute. Close enough for now.

inability to create calculations through a shortcut
This is a comment, intended for usage alongside code blocks in the style of "literate programming" by Donald Knuth. It supports

and other features of Lifemap, which makes it much more useful than ordinary text comments. It means you can link to other files, or even reference specific chunks of code. It also means that your comments and documentation are fully integrated with your codebase, which means that it's less likely for the docs and codebase to diverge over time.

Here is a quintessential demonstration of the classic FizzBuzz problem for determining whether someone has basic programming competencies. The eventual goal is to be able to transpile Lifemap documents into ordinary .ts files by stripping comments and other unnecessary data and then be able to compile them, such that Lifemap itself acts like an IDE.
The map shouldn't capture the scroll event when scrolling down the page, only when actually stopped and scrolling on the map
Fix the box not showing as responsive initially - this requires a window resize.
Make it have a similar behaviour to portals, such that there's one box which acts as a search, and the map reacts to that box.
Why does a random map get created when you create a new line in a new list?
Seems like if you disable the location extension this problem disappears
Create a location node, that has a location attribute - use the wrapper @location@
The mushroom is actually a spore network that lives underground rather than the individual mushroom

The standard for the name "mushroom" is the cultivated white button mushroom, Agaricus bisporus; hence the word "mushroom" is most often applied to those fungi (Basidiomycota, Agaricomycetes) that have a stem (stipe), a cap (pileus), and gills (lamellae, sing. lamella) on the underside of the cap. "Mushroom" also describes a variety of other gilled fungi, with or without stems, therefore the term is used to describe the fleshy fruiting bodies of some Ascomycota. The gills produce microscopic spores which help the fungus spread across the ground or its occupant surface.
Create a regex shortcut for detail insertion
Modify the extension such that it uses motion div animations
dd a group into the details, when expanding it will cause the view to jump somewhere else
Hi, I really admire this design. It means that I can message about things inside the very note taking tool itself, which is far easier than having a blob of chats across all my various chat apps.
Thank you! I'm glad you find the design effective for messaging and note taking within the same tool. It indeed provides convenience and organization compared to scattered chats in different apps.
Fantastic! I‚Äôm about to tell you what we can do for you at your event, but let me check I understand you correctly. Your main goal is to‚Ä¶
Add basic support for embedding uploaded images with their urls
Tags should be selectable such that you can copy and paste if needed
Make sure if tags are wrapped, the whole tag gets wrapped, rather than the tag being broken up across lines
Show styling on tag has been selected when clicked
Decide where to store the lookup table of known tags, emojis and attributes
Design a way to reduce visual clutter by showing/hiding tags
Placeholders are placed in empty content to indicate that some action should be taken.
At Ctrl-K like link insertion with popup menu
run time error when trying to setLink
Ensure that the url parses links like
Make tags clickable, and then do another action
This is the scheduling and syncing portion of time
Make a feature where 1 minute out from the meeting, it forcibly switches your browser window to the meeting, so you never miss a meeting.
Real and unreal (planned version) of these constructs
Events in the future are less real than events closer to now, use exponential decay per day
First you prioritise, using order - what is more or less important?
Then you allocate a period of your life to do this, what year, what seasons
Then you estimate how long it'll take using a quantity
Then you allocate specific dates to ground these plans
Finally, after you attempt the plan, you compare the plan and reality.
Just plain text and traditional representations
Real is a solid block, or cube which encapsulates the time
1 season, 1 month, 1 wk, 1 day, 1 hr, 1 min, 1 sec
The idea of synchronicity, people moving in parallel, not in an explicitly synchronous way, but in a correlated way.
You place specific events in periods, with exceptions like, start after this date, or end after this date.
Only show paragraphs with specific tags like important
Every element is mapped to a dynamic (or static) shortcut
Finalise design and try and implement
Each node will cache its attributes as well as tags inside it in attributes, to make it easier to query these values, and to a lesser extent, save time while querying.
Either from you looking at it, or your cursor being in there.
De-emphasise outdated, or rarely looked upon information
What am I focused on currently?
Visually identify how much attention I've been putting on something
Visually identify the last time I looked at something

Every 10 seconds, one q is added to the element currently being looked at, with value representing the quality of focus as determined by a variety of factors (e.g. context switching, state). For simplicity sake, initially, just use a perfect quality of focus, representing the value 1.
Each qi, will immediately start decaying in an exponential factor, with each time step being a single hour
This way it's possible to see exactly what the current focus is, and has been for the last couple of days.
Show how edited something is, and thus the quality of it
Estimate the quality of something, even if we don't have access to how much editing has gone into it
Every time a sentence is edited, add 1 to the refinement. This one only goes up, even if things are deleted.
Counterpoint: What about a post it note page
The page would be highly refined because of the amount of editing, but the individual bullet point notes would be unrefined. Is that a problem

Use AI classifier to create an approximate equivalent to the number of edits. E.g. If a typical essay would have 100 edits, an equivalent essay of that quality should be identified as 100 edits, despite us not having access to number of edits.
Analogy - Highlights, a circle around things
be focusing on currently, or generally
Basically if a group or line contains
then the most immediate parent will get a border around it. Don't consider bubbling up.
The border looks too hard, is it possible to make the border slightly blurred?
Analogy - colours and vibrance reflecting health of organs from a metaphysical perspective
Understand how I feel about something and explicitly identify any negative attitudes to a particular thing
Things in the future are vague, things in the past are concrete but kind of blurry, things in the present are clear
Analogy - void energy vs wisdom energy
Identify how complete or real something is
Identify the divergence between plan and reality, and help to understand this better
Give the satisfaction of making something "real"
his interface with the refinement dimension?
Something can b unrefined and real e.g. quick chat over the phone, or something can be refined and unreal e.g. a highly edited essay
Alternative is solidity, air vs solid
Or, an outline vs a solid
A group is the sum of all its check boxes, both complete and incomplete. You sum do some kind of weighted average and then that will be the glow colour.

In this section we want to build rapport by being friendly, warm and relatable.
Cover all main questions (don't need to necessarily read everything)
So how's the party planning going so far? Fun?
What's one plus 1? What's two plus two?
Tell me a bit about other weddings you have been to. What did you like or not like about them?
They want their party planning to be super easy
They want it to be cheap
Wants to minimise hassle when organising, make it easy. Very overwhelmed at the moment
Step 3 - Paraphrase and Seed The Sale
